articles.title: Male stalk-eyed flies with short eyestalks are less attractive to females but fight more fiercely, scientists discover - Phys.org
articles.description: In stalk-eyed flies, longer eyestalks attract the ladies. Females prefer males with longer eyestalks, and other males are less likely to fight them for access to females. But some males have a copy of the X chromosome which always causes short eyestalks.
